byline.contributor: Jawad Sukhanyar, Fazal Muzhary, and Ahmad Shakib contributed reporting from Kabul.

abstract: Afghan forces report that former Taliban commander Mullah Abdul Rauf Khadim, who recently pledged allegiance to Islamic State, has been killed along with five of his followers in Helmand Province operation; if confirmed, strike would be first against Islamic State forces in Afghanistan.
lead_paragraph: If confirmed, a strike against Mullah Abdul Rauf Khadim would be the first known military operation undertaken against the Islamic State in Afghanistan.

headline.main: Afghan Strike Is Said to Kill Commander Linked to ISIS
headline.print_headline: Afghan Strike Is Said to Kill Commander Linked to ISIS

snippet: If confirmed, a strike against Mullah Abdul Rauf Khadim would be the first known military operation undertaken against the Islamic State in Afghanistan.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
